title: Man guilty of pushing wife off cliff to her death
text:
Denver - A federal jury has convicted a man of murder in the death of his wife, who fell off a cliff as they hiked in Colorado's Rocky Mountain National Park to celebrate their wedding anniversary.
Jurors on Monday found 59-year-old Harold Henthorn guilty of first-degree murder in the death of Toni Henthorn. Defence attorneys argued that she accidentally fell while snapping a photo and prosecutors' evidence was largely circumstantial.
Prosecutors argued during a two-week trial that Henthorn staged his wife's death to look like an accident because he stood to benefit from her $4.7 million in life insurance policies.
They said Henthorn gave inconsistent accounts of the deadly hike and could not explain why he had a park map with an "X'' drawn at the spot where she fell.
